The moment you see the movie you will realize that it is very low budget movie. Pooh and his friends look like people wearing cheap customs. They dont look like animals, very cheap presentation of the characters.

This is the first time I regret wasting 1 hour and 40 minutes of my life by watching this movie.

I dont recommend at all.

This cheap movie is the silliest movie I ever seen.,two men with masks playing animal characters.

Poor plot and direction. Too much of voilance and blood. The legacy of the original characters has been badly destroyed and disfigured by an amateur act like this movie.

People who care about the legacy of beloved cartoon characters should not have allowed this movie to come out. It is a crime committed to those lovely character to show them as evil blood thirsty creatures opposite to what we thought of them during our childhood. I hope no other beloved cartoon characters be distorted like what happened in this movie.

review_title: Worst horror movie I saw in 2023
review_detailed_main: I watched a lot of short commercials for the movie, it made me really want to experience this movie. However, after researching, I saw that the movie received many bad reviews, so I was quite skeptical about it. But today after watching it I felt it was really bad. The film is quite lacking in logic, the actions and reactions of the characters are annoying, and the film has many holes. I don't even know who the main character is in this movie. Another thing that disappointed me was about the appearance of Pooh and Piglet. To me, these two images are not too scary and do not look realistic. The only thing I feel like the movie is quite good is probably the death scenes. Overall for me this is the worst horror movie I have seen in 2023.

First 20/30 mins was good as it was all about Pooh but once the speaking human characters (which none can act) got involved then it was all down hill. The acting was brutal and was like watching an 80's porn movie without the porn. Defo not worth a watch. Just saying!!! The acting needs far better performances and far better actors. The story line was ok but could have been a lot better. The costumes were below par. This movie had the potential to be so much better but ended up a major let down. Please believe what I'm saying and save your self 90 minutes u wouldn't get back. Ace for gore but that is all is has going for it. 👍🏻

review_title: This entire movie is Poo, nothing but Poo!
review_detailed_main:
No, I did not leave the "H" off the title characters name in my review title. IMDb will not allow me to use the more appropriate synonym for poo, so poo it is.

I was curious about this movie since I read this past week that a teacher in Florida had shown it to a group of fourth graders, causing their parents to become quite irate. Apparently, the fourth graders demanded that the teacher turn off the movie after about 30 minutes, showing once, again, that fourth graders often have better judgment than I do as an adult since I watched all the way through the closing credits. I kept hoping there would be an additional scene that would somehow justify or explain what I just watched, but I was disappointed.

I've heard that the producers were waiting until the first of the Winnie the Pooh books was in the public domain so they could do a sort of mashup movie without fear of being sued by the authors estate, but they apparently were not afraid that viewers of this steaming pile of cinematic garbage would get together a class action suit and sue the producers for insulting our intelligence and wasting our time.

I really loved a lot of other mash ups, such as Abraham Lincoln, vampire Hunter and FDR, American badass, but those movies were so much fun to watch, and this movie was, as I stated, above, a steaming pile of cinematic garbage. This writer found absolutely no redeeming qualities in the entire production. The acting was subpar, the special effects cost about $1.98, The plot made no sense, and there didn't seem to be any discernible theme. Not to mention that the monsters costumes looked like the above mentioned fourth graders, put them together out of odds and ends from their mothers closet.

I gave this one star and recommend that you seek your entertainment elsewhere. I'd like to think that this is probably the worst mashup movie that will ever be made, but I notice on IMDb that a sequel is in the works for a 2024 release. I cannot imagine how the producers can justify a sequel, but as HL Mencken said, no one ever went broke underestimating the taste of the American people.

I cannot say how bad this horror movie is, I mean geez the lack of character brain cells is sad. It's not much of a good plot and doesn't give much to the original Winnie the Pooh story, it's not really supposed to since it's a horror movie but the characters you know and love are blood thirsty murders. The only thing this movie has going for it is the amount of blood that in it. I'm not sensitive to blood at all but even this disturbed me a little. I also can't believe the amount of weird jump scares. Like what is happening you think the scene is going to be an awful jump scare, but all you get is a person walking in and then the victim is dead I'm sorry what? This movie couldn't be any worse. You also don't have any character development, as well as you get 2 seconds of the main character and then they die? I wasn't even attached to them and then they die. You don't care for them. PLEASE DONT WATCH THIS, AND NEVER PAY 3.99$ FOR THIS AWFUL MOVIE!!!!!!

review_title: Absolutely ridiculous that someone paid to fund this
review_detailed_main:
This movie was absolutely terrible, I can accept the terrible masks, I can accept well, no, that's all I can accept.

It opens with relating how pooh, piglet, eyore, rabbit and iirc owl (no tigger at all), are friends with Christopher.... he leaves, they eat eyore, but we only ever see pooh and piglet. Guess they couldn't spring for an extra hundred bucks for a couple more masks?

The choices the people make, as always in slashers, are utterly mind numbing for anyone with common sense.

As far as I know, Britain is stricter with their gun laws than Canada is, and we never get to casually carry a loaded weapon ever if it's locked up, and never get to transport a pistol without it being in a case. The genius in this movie is carrying what looks to be a .44 magnum and can't even remember which drawer she hid it in.

Not that she ever uses it, or loads it with more than 1 round it seems.

A week before this film I was given the news that I was suffering from extreme chronic constipation. I knew something was wrong with me before but the news hit me like a rock to the groin. I tried pulling, pushing, exfoliating. I even went to a chiropractor. As a final resort I messaged an old homeschool family of mine to see if they had any essential oils that could resolve the issue. To my dismay, none of these worked. I'm pretty sure the oils made it worse. Sad and alone, I gained 15 lbs. Before I had watched this film.

Friends of mine who knew but couldn't understand what I was going through asked if I would like to join them for Winne-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey. I watched the trailer, which was quite horrifying from what I saw, and was unsure if I should join my friends. I learned shortly after that it was a b-movie, and so I consented. I am so glad that I did go.

As I munched on my popcorn and drank my Coke Zero sugar, wondering how how I was going to get this out later, I felt the hairs on my neck stand up. I refocused on the movie to see the horrifying images on the screen. And for the first time in three weeks, I crapped. It wasn't like a small crap or even a normal crap, but like the crap-god that sits on the crap-throne kind of crap. When I had finally realized what had happened, I noticed that it wasn't the gore even the faces of the deformed animals, it was, in fact the faces of British women.

Knowing that the smell was going to be pungent, I went home early, for the sake of my friends who sat near me. So unfortunately, I wasn't able to finish the movie, but it deserves a rewatch from me, not out of enjoyment necessarily, although that is there, but out of respect. For Winnie the pooh saved my life.

I will admit this was not a good movie but it did have its moments, especially the killing scenes. Those scenes were pretty memorable, especially the car death scene and the first scene. The movie basically explores how Winnie-the-Pooh and his gang go feral and have to find food on their own after Christopher Robin grows up, goes to college and abandons them. When he returns to 100 Acre Forest, he finds what they have become and shortly afterwards so do some campers, and a killing spree ensues.

The idea of Winnie the Pooh as a serial killer might not be the best one, and the idea is poorly and silly executed, but if you want to give it a try please do.

** out of ****

review_title: It's not horror. It's horrible. Thoughtlessly horrible.

review_detailed_main:
This is not a real review, it should be understood more as a collection of impressions on the film.

This movie is pure garbage and the worst part is that it's not even bad enough to be funny, it's just plain, awful garbage. First of all, the plot sucks because the bad guys could have been anyone and they would have worked anyway, then the characters have too obvious plastic masks that should look real but are too plasticky. The problem is also that at the beginning the film seems nice and particular, but after the first quarter of an hour it becomes the classic splatter with powerful killers like all the others and has nothing to do with Winnie the Pooh.

review_title: Bring your writer friends, sneak in some honey

review_detailed_main: "Winnie the Pooh: Blood and Honey" is a movie that you might watch out of sheer curiosity or morbid fascination, but it's difficult to recommend it to anyone, especially those with a deep affection for the lovable characters from A. A. Milne's classic tales. The movie attempts to blend the innocent world of Winnie the Pooh with the horrifying elements of a slasher movie, and the result is jarring. While it does have its moments in terms of delivering horror, it feels like the narrative could have worked just as well without the beloved Hundred Acre Wood inhabitants. In fact, the inclusion of these characters seems more like a marketing ploy than a genuine effort to tell a compelling story. The scares in "Blood and Honey" are intense, and it's evident that the creators intended to shock and horrify their audience. However, the entire premise feels somewhat forced. The juxtaposition of the cute and cuddly characters against a gruesome and violent backdrop is simply uncomfortable to watch. The movie's concept draws more from the likes of "The Strangers" or "Texas Chainsaw Massacre," making you wonder if this film should have even included the Winnie the Pooh characters in the first place. The excessive gore and violence are a far cry from the wholesome stories we've come to associate with Pooh, Tigger, Piglet, and their friends. While it's true that going into this film, one would anticipate a departure from the usual, the degree to which it veers off track might still catch you off guard. "Winnie the Pooh: Blood and Honey" is a bizarre attempt to mesh the world of childhood nostalgia with adult horror, and it doesn't quite succeed. If you're a fan of the classic characters, it's best to steer clear, as this film tarnishes their wholesome image in a way that feels almost sacrilegious. While it might provide a few cheap thrills for those who enjoy extreme horror, for most, it's best to preserve your fond memories of the Hundred Acre Wood and pass on this unsettling reinterpretation. Sometimes, it's better to leave the classics as they are, untouched and untarnished by the darkness of the horror genre.

This movie COULD HAVE been ok. But it's probably the worst movie I've seen in a long time. Worst acting, worst special effects, the gore was alright I guess. But for the most part an absolute piece of crap. I'm almost sorry I wasted my time watching it. Who ever directed this had very little imagination. Very little skill and far too much time on their hands. What the hell? It would have have been more interesting to watch paint dry, or grass grow. If you haven't seen it yet, don't. I've never even reviewed a movie on this platform. But this movie was so bad I had to make a profile just so I could.

review_title: Not weird, not artistic, not scary. Just bad
review_detailed_main:
As many others have mentioned, the only good thing is the beginning where they explain why the animals have gone feral but the rest is just plain boring.

The acting is very bad. I don't think I've ever seen such bad acting in a movie before.

It's quite common to watch slasher movies which are bad but in the end, they were so bad that they were funny, this one was just bad.

The plot is uninteresting and has nothing to do with Winny the Pooh. The group of the girls had nothing to do in the movie. There is no story. It is not even possible to give spoilers because there is no story to tell.

The editing is terrible. Some scenes were shot fine but most of them aren't. The lighting is usually bad, The smoke effect is overused and not relevant.

The writing is also very bad. The dialogues are almost nonsensical and the scenes are poorly written.

There is simply nothing good in this movie and I would give it 0 if it were possible.

review_title: Poor in almost every manner possible
review_detailed_main:
Winnie the Pooh: Blood and Honey is incomprehensible in how ill-written and catastrophically-constructed it is and goes through every horror cliche in the book while featuring characters with paper-thin character development.

The only elements that aren't utterly woeful are the cinematography and sound design where both have been treated with the right amount of care and clearly had people behind them wanting to do a adequate job.

The script on the other hand, feels like a rushed-out and effortless piece of work from a group of people desperate to capitalise on the Winnie-the-Pooh character becoming public domain. Director Rhys Frake Waterfield then seemed to struggle with a lack of confidence at the helm when directing his actors leading to an unbelievably long list of facepalming moments for audiences to sit through.

What could have been a fun and entertaining alternative Winnie-the-Pooh film in the right hands inevitably tumbled into contention for being not only one of the worst films of the year but of the 2020s so far.

I didn't have high expectations coming into the film, given the reviews and feedback thus far. The film starts out with a cool animated story that gives the background and setup for the initial scene.

The cinematography and sets are pretty good for the budget and the acting is fine.

The film is one that I wouldn't return to for additional viewings. I enjoy horror schlock as much as anyone, especially 80's slashers, often low budget films. This is where they missed the mark. There is a lack of camp and tongue-in-cheek fun that there was so much opportunity to use given the nature of the movie.

The filmmaker relied solely on twisted, brutal torture scenes to make his mark here. Not a laugh to be found. We are talking about the beloved Winnie the Pooh franchise and the director didn't elevate the material to show the silliness and self-awareness that makes so many slashers fun and enjoyable.

Oh bother...

If you go down to the woods today , you're in for a big surprise 😮 Winnie the Pooh Blood and Honey will not disappoint... if you're into slasher/horror movies this is the one for 2023.. the imagination put into this is second to none, a great British made horror movie with so many scenes that will have you on the edge if your seat.. trust me you'll love it 👍Winnie and Piglet have changed a little bit, you might notice that. The production and writing have shown a great collaboration and the cinematography is excellent considering this is a low budget flick, you horror fans will not want to miss this 100%

A fun movie based on the original version of Winnie the Pooh by AA Milne. I love a good horror film and Winnie the Pooh - blood and honey did not disappoint. It is definitely worth a watch for horror fans. I had to watch this low budget movie after all the hype and media attention it received and it didn't let me down .....and NO it didn't ruin my childhood!

They made the most of the opportunity to turn a cute bear and pig into 2 crazy monsters on a killing rampage, however very imaginative and great fun. Considering the budget they had to make the film the locations were amazing. The music was awesome and very appropriate to the scenes.

Well done to everyone involved in the making of this movie.

review_title: I wanted it to be good
uhh it's a no from me

review_detailed_main: Ok, let me preface this by saying I was really looking forward to this movie. Unfortunately, it didn't live up to what I expected. I kinda understand some of the initial plot, but then it just meanders into the realm of why? Where are we going with this? The dialog is mediocre and the acting isn't much better. It looks like they grabbed some new faces to keep it fresh, but the talent was lacking. The special effects were something you might see from first year FX students and the kills weren't terribly imaginative at all. After watching it, I saw that apparently a sequel has already been green lit. I'm. It sure how or why, but it did. I hope it is better than this one.

I found it really awful without any logical scenario couldn't believe how poorly written and executed the whole thing was. It felt like a complete waste of time and money. The characters were one-dimensional, the dialogue was cringeworthy, and the plot made no sense whatsoever. I kept waiting for it to redeem itself, but it just got worse and worse. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone, not even my worst enemy. I can't believe I wasted my time and money on such a terrible movie. The acting was atrocious, the plot made no sense, and the special effects were laughable. I felt like I was being tortured for two hours straight. Save yourself the agony and steer clear of this disaster.

review_title: Felt like a b level film
If u give it a chance, you will have fun and a bloddy time

review_detailed_main:
No pun intended - the movie was going for a while and I was ready to write: where is the honey in all of this ... but then it came into play (another pun you say? Well maybe) ... but of course there is more blood here than honey. Which means you should expect this to be ... exactly what it is. Something poor Christopher Robin does not ... for obvious reasons. Now the acting in that introduction is not the best you will be seeing ever ... especially the whole back and forth (disbelieve, than fear over nothing in particular) ... but if you suspend your disbelief you can have some fun watching this. Do not mind the forgettable characters this has in it.

Especially the effects ... the movie knows it ... lingering or cutting back to ... what you might call money shots. No puns intended here I reckon - unless you like them - then they would be intended. Now the costumes are ... well they are quite clearly costumes .. so take this with a grain of salt. Tongue in cheek or whatever you want to call it ... go with the flow ... it is about ... gore and mayhem and general horror ... and it will continue whether you like it or not .. I reckon the name things did draw enough people and it made enough money.

Your childhood dreams may have been destroyed ... but only if you watch it ... do not watch it if you are squeamish, this was not made for you! I assume the sequel will have a bigger budget and some more ... killer ideas!

Yeah i have to say this was not a god film in any way. The acting is really bad but i think the problem was the script and it was paper thin. The violence was mainly off screen i will say they did a few scenes quite well though. The idea is cool but the finale was not done in any way that is good. The movie had a sequel i did not bother but to be honest looked ok. The problem with this film there was no build up of the characters or anything that you cared about. I understand the idea of making this film but it did not live up to expectations for me or most people judging by the reviews by critics,

review_title: Winnie The Pooh it just Stinks
review_detailed_main: Grade Z Garbage it's actually worse than Grade Z There is no acting some semblance Of a story of revenge and several gratuitous kills and a couple of bare breasts all the ingredients of a great slasher ... but for mine it just fails on all levels and becomes comical in its cardboard nature The premise of using story time characters is novel but it could have been done so much better .. Still on a shoe string Budget Rhys Frake-Waterfield has managed to no doubt create larger than life characters that I'm sure will return in a sequel and will no doubt become a Jason or Freddy character slashing his way to millions $100000 Budget and a $9000,000 return is sure to see interest in doing more of this rubbish ... Perhaps Winnie will join forces with Goldilocks and The Three Bears in the next instalment ..

This is by far one of the worst films I've ever seen. I can't believe they're making a second one! The acting was horrible as well as the story line. I would give this a negative 5 stars if I could! Don't kill your brain cells watching this nonsense.

It started slow and the beginning was stupid. There was no build up at all. The backstory was trash as well. I watched it with 5 other people and only one person kind of liked it. The only reason they liked it was because it had a lot of violence and gore. Other than that the rest of us absolutely hated it. The only reason we watched it until the end was because we wanted to see how the story played out. To no surprise the ending was just as stupid as the beginning.

This could have been soooo good!

I was at first surprised at how low the audience ratings were; but as I watched it became abundantly clear that this was death by a thousand cuts.

What makes it worse in some ways is that certain elements were far superior to 90% of horror films out there today.

The cinematography was excellent! From the lighting to the framing composition to the basic great quality; it leaves the all to often grainy, poorly lit quality of most modern horrors in the dust.

The solid acting was also somewhat surprising. Unfortunately, they killed off one of their best actors, Paula Coiz, almost immediately.

Her portrayal of Christopher Robin's love provided a solid foundation that really grounded the film right off the bat.

In Mary, Coiz's character, you had someone related to a central figure from the original stories that was innocent and outside those original stories. She was the audiences eyes and ears. She was perfect for drawing the audience in and experience this strange world from her point of view.

Moreover, she gave us someone to care about. She was obviously a good person and supportive of Christopher even though she believed his childhood stories to be a figment of a young highly imaginative mind.

She was also set apart by not being Christopher; the uninteresting silly looking boy from the cartoon movies we remembered as kids. Furthermore, it was Christopher's abandonment of our beloved woodland friends that started all this mess.

So the audience won't care about him nearly as much as they would an innocent supportive spouse doing her best not to dismiss Christopher's fanciful tales out of hand.

But the filmmaker quickly threw all that away.

The entire movie could have been built around her and Christopher trying to survive while at the same time attempting to reconnect and recover the beloved friends Christopher knew.

But nope. The filmmakers had to dive head first into mediocre horror film troupes.

Besides the horrible storyline, not to mention the awful dialogue, that killed the film for most people were the COSTUMES!!!

The look like that were designed and crafted over a weekend. Despite being told at the beginning that our animal friends have abandoned anything that made them human-like; they dressing in human clothing and leave a pathetic impression in the viewer's mind of just men in jeans and flannel with oversized latex masks on.

Personally, I would have casted the often underused and overlooked vertically challenged members of the acting community. Yes, I mean actors who happen to have dwarfism.

The Hundred Acres woods creatures would look sooo much better and realistic. Full body costumes would be so much better. I also wouldn't be completely thrown off by the fact that Piglet and Pooh were now somehow TALLER than a grown up sized Christopher Robins.

Besides, what would be more frightening than being chased by overpowered, animalistic, kid sized, revenge driven monsters?

I'm not sure what I just watched...Clearly someone has way too much time on their hands and is obsessed with different ways of killing people. At first it was funny and stupid but watching it more almost makes you want to turn the movie off. I like gore but this was a little too much for me and made me slightly sick to my stomach. If you like lots of gore, then this movie is right up your alley! But if not, don't even try and watch it. It's basically a movie with creepy pig and bear masks that enjoy killing people. That's it. That's the movie. Who will be friends forever? Clearly not Piglet, Pooh or Christopher Robin.

review_title: Winnie the Pooh Meets Jason Voorhees
review_detailed_main: Falling into the public domain, the Hundred Acre Woods is mostly free-game for anyone with a story to tell. Winnie the Pooh: Blood and Honey takes the beloved children's characters and asks the burning question that EVERYONE has wanted answered for the past 100 years: 'What if these children's characters were vicious killer animals?' Sarcasm aside, this ridiculous mash-up is one I never thought I'd see, but I went in hoping to find a surprisingly good movie, or at least one charming enough to eventually be a cult classic. Unfortunately, this has almost nothing to offer as a movie, parody, or slasher. The story is as basic as possible, with almost nothing happening throughout. In a rare interesting moment, the opening animatic is actually quite entertaining and animated in a unique way. Immediately after that, the film loses all uniqueness, fitting as a low tier sequel to the already poor quality Friday the 13th franchise. The acting is cheesier than cheddar, with the line deliveries sinking almost as hard as the lines themselves. The slaughters, which should be the most entertaining part, are mostly obscured or basic. The characters barely resemble their source, with nothing except the names connecting them. I understand why someone made this movie, as the name itself is enough to make some money off intrigued viewers, but the smallest amount of effort outside of that could have made this some kind of a memorable hit. Sadly, Winnie the Pooh: Blood and Honey applies little to no effort in this uninteresting slasher, not even worth a curiosity watch.

I had such high hopes when i heard about this film. Upon recommendation from a friend, I decided to give this a go.

For every entertaining portion of the film, there is an equally annoying aspect that simply cannot be forgiven. A lot of missed opportunities with this film.

I can't say that I would watch it again, it was a convoluted mess. I assume the actual story is still sitting on the cutting room floor.

Clichéd as ever, but at least the ending, pointless as it was, kept with the flow of ridiculousness and might have been the best part of the film.

A collective sigh of relief as the movie ended. I heard the sequel was/is much better. It would be hard to be any worse than this.

Entertainment Value 3/10 Overall Rating 2.5/10

Quite possibly one of the worst films i've ever seen. I would recommend watching this as high as possible.

review_title: A REAL TRIP IN EVERY WAY!
review_detailed_main:
If there's one thing I can say about this movie, it's that it doesn't disappoint in giving you a festival of guts, blood and honey just by starting.

From the beginning, the film manages to completely detach itself from what was imposed by Disney, taking its own course both with good decisions and with other somewhat questionable ones. There is a lot that can be explored and improved on this twisted journey... But that doesn't take away the magic of this movie.

It's not for everyone, that's clear, but if you wanna have a good time watching these childhood icons in their crudest facet, this movie is for you!

The direction, cinematography, setting, the score and Pooh and Piglet themselves are some things in which this film shines on its own.

100% Recommended.

review_title: it could be great with a bigger budget
review_detailed_main: The idea of taking a cute character of your childhood and turning him into a serial killer was silly and clever at the same time.. the old fashioned slasher recipe of taking 5 youngsters at a quite place in the woods being attacked by a creepy maniac is my favorite and always entertains me.. you add some nudity, some silly decisions and the gore begins... but unfortunately the budget was so low i guess, that actors were unknown to me and the acting was literally bad (the so called Christopher tried a little bit more than all the others), the customs were fake, and some death scenes seemed funny instead of creepy... so i believe the main problem was the low budget that put the movie down.. if they had better CGI and better actors the movie would be much more believable. After all the storyline was good enough,there was plenty of gore and it wasn't that long to get bored. Deserves better rating for sure.. i 've seen worse movies. Go for it, just don't take it seriously...

review_title: Not as fun as I'd hoped for!
Just...Don't. Just Keep Scrolling. You Will Find Something Better
review_detailed_main:
First off, let me just say that I love horror movies.

Now that's out of the way.

This movie was a complete waste of time. It was also a complete waste of $100,000. The director needs to be taken out to the backyard and put out of his misery.

I'm not going to delve into spoilers. To say that it wasted a great premise is an understatement. As much as I love a B-horror movie, this one barely rates a letter it's that bad.

I can hurl every adjective at this waste of film.

I'd rather inspect my own vomit than to ever watch this. It was torture to watch and not in a good way.

Zero stars.

Crap.

After reading so many poor reviews for some reason I was intrigued. Could it really be that bad?

I went into this really hoping it would have some redeeming qualities such as some comedy, as this movie is about a murderous fictional character that has been loved by millions for almost a hundred years. Unfortunately, it really has no redeeming qualities as the story is pretty predictable, bland with nothing really that exciting happening throughout.

The plot is very forgettable due to it's underwhelming nature, yet you are likely to not forget about this movie due to the disappointment it is.

Simply, it is not on the same scale as other slashers, and should really only be watched if you're purposely watching a poorly made film.

This no budget film was so horribly written and executed, with acting so bad that I finished watching ONLY to feel satisfaction that everyone died.

Absolutely NO originality and brought back the cliche of 80's horror films, only a thousand times worse.

The idea that anyone should have to pay to watch this is utterly stupid.

With movies like this there needs to be a refund policy.

The concept and plot had such great potential yet the director, storyline, acting, special effects and execution was so poorly done that this director should have retired before they had even begun.

It's so sad to say that the only highlight of this movie was the brief nudity of one of the murder scenes. Pathetic.....

Watched it with a friend, and we were dying laughing the entire time. Possibly the worst horror movie I've ever seen. The idea of child-friendly creatures turning deadly was good, as most fairytales were actually once twisted stories, but not at all well-executed. The gore was cheap, the sounds were just funny, and the acting was decent but not convincing. I found myself laughing quite a few times, and dare I say, the accent was killing me. The plot was nonsense. None of the characters were memorable. All the female characters looked the same to me, and I found my friend asking me "Wait, didn't she already die?" quite a few times.

Overall, not a good movie. Don't waste your time and move on to something better. 2023 was a good year for the horror genre, but this was just not it.

review_title: What in the world did I just watch?
review_detailed_main:
When I saw the previews for this, it piqued my interest. I like a good retelling of classics with a horror twist. I tried it despite not being a huge slasher fan. I watched the film with an open mind, and after finishing moments ago, I am completely underwhelmed.

All it is, is Texas Chainsaw Masacre meets Winnie the Pooh. The gore is definitely there since I had to look away a few times.

There is zero character development, and the writing is subpar. The acting is decent considering it is mostly girls screaming their heads off most of the time. It would have been interesting if they had some sort of twist to make it a little better than just Pooh and Piglet whacking off people left and right.

I just wish they had included other Winnie the Pooh character like Rabbit, Tigger, and Owl in the film. And maybe my hour and half minutes back. Not worth the watch.

review_title: Beloved Childhood character turned into a slasher yet get ready for a Bloody good time!!!
review_detailed_main: Hey everyone! Here's my review for Winnie-The-Pooh: Blood and Honey. Pretty good movie,good story it's a horror retelling of Winnie the Pooh stories it follows Pooh and Piglet, who have now become feral and bloodthirsty murderers, as they terrorize a group of young university women and an adult Christopher Robin when he returns to the Hundred Acre Wood years later after leaving for college. Good cast,solid acting everyone does a good job in their performances,intense lead,memorable characters one of them is given a dark backstory,two creepy intimidating yet bada** killers,character relationships are solid one character decides to make a life or death decision in exchange for another character's life,the death scenes are brutal,bloody yet creative,the gore/makeup effects are practical which I appreciated,very gory,flashbacks occur,a couple callbacks to the Winnie the Pooh franchise itself,hand drawn animation gets referenced,scary at times,well shot cinematography to help build a creepy atmosphere,a little bit of adult content,tons of swearing,spooky music,major twists,one callback to another horror film,good directing this was the directorial debut of Rhys Waterfield he did a good job with the direction I can't wait to see what other famous childhood characters are made into slasher villains and has a surprise twist ending I didn't expect. Overall I really enjoyed this film I went into with very low expectations I'll be honest I was a big Winnie the Pooh as a kid especially the Disney version,taking a beloved childhood character making him into a slasher villain is cool,something different,for an independent horror film I was intrigued and is definitely worth a watch. I give Winnie-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey a 8.9/10 stars!!!

review_title: It's not as bad as it seems
review_detailed_main: They could have made better use of the plot, yes. The starting part of the movie was actually quite good, good story beginning. The problem is that the movie was made with such a low budget, so they tried quite hard to make it closer to a more expensive production, but failed. If the casting was better, with better editing (timing, sound & music background) & the killings were done in a more creative & drastic way, it would have become a great horror movie. What a waste of a good plot. One more thing : if they want to include some sexual elements into the movie, they could have done it in a better way but reducing the number of unnecessary casts so they can have a bigger budget for that (e.g. Fewer girls, maybe just 2-3, and no need to have a group of guys driving in a 4-wheelers who died within less than 5 mins. A simple 1-person drive-by police or old man will do).

Wow, I'm shocked at what I just watched. So bad, I had to come here and see what others thought. It started off with a good premise, and the sketched beginning was good, but it was downhill from there. Every time I thought 'ok, the plot is going to make a turn for the best', it didn't and instead either went in the opposite direction or just dropped off. The costumes were horrible, I think they went to Spirit Halloween to buy the masks. Also, what was with the flickering lights every time there was a kill. Once or twice, ok, but seriously, every single time, thats just too much. Don't watch this movie if you have photosensitive epilepsy. Too many dark scenes. No plot, no ending, just a waste of time.

In the world of horror cinema, there's a peculiar subgenre where some films are so outrageously dreadful that they achieve an almost cult-like appeal. But, dear reader, this particular cinematic disaster? It doesn't even deserve the label "bad." It's an abomination.

From the cringe-worthy acting to the abysmal writing, from the laughably disjointed plot to the sheer audacity of neglecting any semblance of character development, this movie is a spectacular trainwreck. It's not one of those guilty pleasures that you secretly enjoy for its terribleness; it's a torment from start to finish. Filled with more holes than Swiss cheese, devoid of a protagonist worth caring about, and populated by characters so unremarkable and repugnant, you'll question the sanity of anyone who claims to derive pleasure from it.

It's high time for those responsible for this cinematic catastrophe to do humanity a favor and exit the film industry. Their glaring absence of talent, discernment, and empathy for their unsuspecting audience is nothing short of a travesty, and they should be held accountable.

review_title: Fraudulent due to its blandness cliche and missed opportunities. Grade: D-

review_detailed_main:
What a sad waste of what could have been an awesome movie. This movie is too boring and predictable. It would have been great to watch a clever movie with a horror twist starring the lovely Winnie the Pooh in an unexpected role, and I was really looking forward to a wild movie experience, but after 10 minutes you already know what's about to happen and everything just stinks.

The costumes for Pooh and Piglet are seriously ridiculous. No creativity.

If you are intrigued by this storyline and wondering if you should watch this killer Winnie the Pooh premise, the answer is NO. Do not waste your time. It is really, really bad.

review_title: As bad as it could possibly be
As Much as I wanted to be proved wrong, it was C***P
review_detailed_main:
First of all, it is a scary tale. And it does feel like a Horror film with the dark setting and the dimly lit rooms. But, I'd never thought I'd see the day that a beloved childhood classic would turn into a dark and twisted story, but hear we are. Reviewing this "R" rated story. The Woods is also a good setting to create a creepy atmosphere for a Horror film. So let's review, Winnie the Pooh:Blood and Honey.

To start of with, the movie did not look promising. It had boring and uninspiring voice acting that read out why Pooh and the Piglet were on a revengeful mission after Christopher had to leave them to go to College. The Narrator does not seem very engaging and it left alot to be desired, it just felt as if he was bored to death and didn't want to be there, but after that we do get a nice view of the trees down below. And we get some photographic images to show Cristopher leaving, which was very cool.

His girlfriend was badly written, but Christopher was mostly fine. He goes back to see them, unfortunately for him he doesn't know that they killed one of the members after being left hungry. Either way it didn't seem believable as to why they would kill one of there members, especially when they'd been together for so long. But regardless of that, Chis shares old memories about the place. Pooh and Piglet find them, and try and kill the both of them, Christopher had to watch his girlfriend die before he was then torchered.

It looses focus on that side of the story, and we are left with four girls who have no choralation to the story of Christopher and Pooh, and even Piglet. This is another flaw, Christopher is hardly in the film, even though we all know he is the main character. It could of developed nicely, but there story feels shoehorned in rather then feeling earnt as it's without any real merit. With this said, I don't think the girls are bad protagonists. The Writing wasn't dreadful, and the main one had some depth.

Now the whole Christopher thing could just be a me problem, but if they are too touch on other characters, they have to of been written better so we can care about them. As I said previously, the main girl is decently written and we know she has had a dark past. But the others don't really have anything meaningful to look back on. Yes they show confidence and bravery, and one even obsessed with the Internet, but these tropes shouldn't carry an entire story. As nobody will care much about them when they die.

They focused on the brutal deaths, and they had so much killings in the space of an hour and 20 minutes. Overall, the film in my eyes should have had Christopher and his College friends introduced into the story, so we had more lore on the universe these characters are in.

Would I recommend this film?

If you like looking back at the past and having some Flashbacks then that part of the film is okay, the rest of it you can just skip.

Winnie the Pooh: Blood and Honey tries to reinvent the classic children's story with a darker and more violent twist, but ultimately falls short. The film's gratuitous use of gore and violence serves only to shock and cheapen the characters and the message of the original story. The plot lacks coherence and fails to capture the magic of the original characters, while trying to capitalize on their popularity. Despite a few clever and humorous moments, the film can be difficult to enjoy due to its overly violent tone. In the end, Winnie the Pooh: Blood and Honey is a lackluster attempt at reinventing a beloved childhood classic.

Absolute, utterly failure of a movie.

It's a bog-standard, extremely boring, cheaply made slasher flick that never utilizes anything interesting from its premise. There's no flow. You won't remember any of the film's characters apart from Christopher Robin and only because of him being part of the Winnie the Pooh stories.

It's also free of any irony or humour. I've seen many movies in which the premise was taken seriously, but I haven't seen a degree on how far this could be displaced until I've seen Blood & Honey. The tone brutally clashes with what is shown, which is often ridiculous.

On top of it all: The effects work (or lack there of) is beyond dismal. At least make your gore practical. Instead they've chosen CG of such a quality, it would've been laughed out of any decently made internet video.

review_title: There are guidelines to watching this movie
review_detailed_main:
I kind of had a feeling this movie would end up getting a bad rap. The way things all got hyped up there a lot of people seemed to have forgotten that this movie was never made to be a million budget slasher Hollywood masterpiece. It was made as a low budget independent film with a first time director, which is totally fine, but I don't think its what everyone was expecting. I get that people are all going to have their own opinions, some will hate it, some will love it. But If you are interested in seeing this movie there are certain things you MUST keep in mind or it will be a real waste of your time.

First- you need to forget EVERYTHING you ever knew about Winnie the Pooh because there is no comparison here. This is a completely different take on the characters, and It' s a completely different story line, sort of like a multi-verse thing. In this version the characters look strange and grow up stranger

Second- take NOTHING seriously. There are plenty of horror films out there to take seriously and this is NOT one of them.

Third- keep a very, very open mind!!!!

To rephrase what I said before this film is not for everyone. But going to see the film with this mind set can, I feel at least, make the whole thing a lot more enjoyable.

If you know the story of how/why this movie was made, then there should be no surprise as to how cheesy this movie is. It's a cheap throwback/slasher movie....that's it! If you are expecting Freddy, Jason or Myers, with a decent plot and acting, then go watch those movies. This is literally a turn your brain off and watch some gore kind of movie. If you like old school slasher movies, than this is at least worth a watch. Yes, it's dumb. Yes, there is pointless nudity, Yes, the acting is bad. But so were 99% of the slasher movies from the 70's and 80's. It's just a fun/dumb popcorn movie, nothing more.

review_title: I thought movies were supposed to have a plot?

review_detailed_main: First off as a child I was a huge fan of Winnie Pooh. I loved the books cartoons and etc. When I heard about this movie it intrigued me. The thought of Christopher leaving them and then them becoming feral sounded pretty good. I knew it would not be a blockbuster movie off the get go. However I was still interested in giving it a watch. Boy did they fail with this one. It's almost like the director and writer really gave the movie no thought and just pulled it out of an idea then filled the rest in with filler to make a movie. It is horrible! Pooh and Piglet look ridiculous, just two men with masks on. The acting is just laughable. Save yourself and do not put yourself through the misery as I did.

review_title: Not worth your time or money
review_detailed_main:
I had next to no intention of watching this film when it was initially announced, but I stumbled across it being filmed in Ashdown Forest in April of last year and after watching for a grand total of 5 seconds decided that it wasn't worth my money, thank god cam-rips still exist in this day and age.

Winnie the Pooh: Blood and Honey was more of a case that the filmmakers could rather than if they should. It's a by-the-books slasher with no humour or charm that tarnishes the image of a children's icon and not even in the clever way that The Banana Splits Movie does.

Blood and Honey is the worst kind of movie, devoid of a soul and meaning, it was made for the sake of being made for shock value and to get people talking about it in the hopes it got an ironic appeal out of it. Well, they succeeded in that first half but failed at the second, there's no ironic enjoyment to be found here, it's just that bad.

When it came clear that Winnie The Pooh was in the public domain I knew someone would take the honours to make a horror flick starring Winnie.

Without any expectations at all I went to the theatre to see this weird flick. How are they going to show Winnie and friends. Flick starts really well with a cartoon about the friendship but after 2 minutes things already go wrong, Christopher is leaving the 100 acre woods and Winnie and friends become evil. End of the cartoon and the movie really starts.

Couldn't say start because the opening scene takes ages; The main problem with this flick, most of the scene's are way too long. Editing?

But not only that is a prob, the acting is way below mediocre and the way the girls react to situations is really unseen.

Of course the director do knows the classic tricks, add a bit of nudity and sexy bath tub scene's and people will be happy. But it's a horror so is it scary?

It's not scary but what it do offer are some nasty gory killings. The red stuff is available.

So for me it wasn't that bad after all, but still under mediocre. It's one you go see with friends without any expectations at all.

Gore 1/5 Nudity 0,5/5 Effects 1,5/5 Story 1/5 Comedy 0/5.

You know when folk say something is so bad it's good? Well this is so bad it's bloody awful. A. A Milne must be spinning in his grave. The killer costumes were terrible, not scary, certainly not scary bear looking. The lead ladies were there just to show a bit of sexy stuff before being crumped in various non imaginative ways. I feel sorry for the young cast in productions like this. Exploited to make some production execs a few quid. I will end on a positive though, the fella playing Christopher Robin showed some talent given the role he has asked to play, acting his ass off, although i don't imagine the future him will be referencing this dross in interviews should he get anywhere in his career. Avoid.

review_title: Don't waste your time watching this movie!
review_detailed_main: You get excited when you start watching the movie, but as the movie progresses, it gets worse and worse. As you watch more, you get the feeling that it is a low budget movie! Most of the actors were not good! Lots of moments in the movie, don't make sense! For example, when some of actors towards the end try to kill Pooh towards the end of the movie, they crash their cars in attempts to kill him, but they forgot (for some unknown reason) to put seatbelts and ended up injuring themselves! This happened twice! Lots of unnecessary gore scenes! It's just bad, silly scenes kept happening until the very end! The movie did not end properly, which means that there will be part 2. For sure, I will not watch part 2, neither in the theatres nor on TV!

It's a good horror movie with some dumb elements, bad costumes, decent effects . But i found it very entertaining. Its silly , gory, and just a good horror flick. I like a horror movie with a mean spirited edge to it , this has that in surplus. It's a throwback to old slasher movies , there is a scene that is a mid to Texas Chainsaw Massacre. The guy playing Christopher Robin is annoying, but the movie had some unintentional humor in it. The pool scene is ridiculous but the kill scene is really done well. Overall is a good horror movie with a good premise and honestly.. watching Winnie the Pooh lay people out was just fun.

Initially i was skeptical about this film. Yeah, more than likely this was just a bloated cash-grab on the IP that recently entered the cyberspace. It only existed for shock value off the titular characters, and did nothing with the brand. But, being a horror acolyte, i saw this film anyways.

I was exactly right.

Instead of taking the IP and bringing to some dark, twisted vision, Blood and Honey would rather dabble with old tropes and horror cliches, exploit the IP for shock attention and abandon any creative nuance that it may have had going for it. The result is a bleak, interchangeable slasher flick that doesn't try anything new or interesting despite the obvious prospects it has placed before it.

The characters are so wooden, they'd blend into the 100-Acre Wood, and only exist to be brutalized by Pooh & co, whose characters is to ensure an R-rating; your typical unstoppable horror movie villain. The tone is far too serious for this film, the lack of any authentic horror or humor hurts far worse as this film lacks any real identity among the endless ocean of slasher films, no thanks to its startling lack of creativity.

Had Blood and Honey heeded the idea of a horror comedy, this could've been something far better - if not incredible. Take a page from The Banana Splits Movie, where the comedic undertone balanced out the horrors and humor because the it didn't take itself too seriously; it was self aware, unlike this film.

This film isn't worth your time, nor is it worth anything in the horror genre.

Everything stupid you've ever seen in horror is magnified 200%. Right when they are in the middle of a horrific scene instead of running the all decide to chat like they are in the middle of a tea party and it happens more than a couple of times. Lots of blood and gore and everything gross but it was like a really bad Texas Chain Saw Massacre. I was really looking forward to watching this ; I thought with such a great title this had lots of potential but there were just too many "oh my God this is stupid" scenes I had to make sure to write about the rediculousness appearing too many times. Trust me you'll want to pass on this one!

review_title: Not really worth it, even as a bad movie enjoyer
review_detailed_main:
I'll start off by saying I'm probably the target audience of something like this, I love love love movies that are so bad they're good, low budget slashers are something I often enjoy, honestly the stupider the better. This was just one of many such films on my list to watch this year and I was excited to laugh at bad effects and the weird premise.

But I didn't like this, it was honestly disappointing. I found it very hard to follow what was happening, who the characters were, honestly at times even really see what was going on because the lighting was so dim. Most of it made no sense, and not just in a funny bad movie way more in a "did I miss something?" Way.

Honestly what kind of redeemed it was I was watching a pirated copy that kept having online slots machine ads pop up over dramatic scenes and that was funny and entertaining.

To quote my friend "I don't regret watching it but maybe they should regret making it"

Look, I'm all for trash cinema and even enjoying the "so bad it's good" films. The only reason why I give this two stars instead of one is simply for the fact that this film plays as a straight slasher instead of making a purposely bad film. However, it's just a bad film. I know ITN and how they give their filmmakers the short end of the stick behind the scenes and rush their productions, and unfortunately for the filmmakers here, it shows. And it's even more unfortunate because I can see some potential for the director. Some of the shots and the way things are set up look really nice, but you can only go so far with so little time. In the end, this movie is going to make a lot more than was given to the filmmakers to play with, I just hope they learn from their mistakes with the sequel. And I hope some production company other than ITN sees the director's potential and give him a fair chance.

review_title: The idea is good the execution is awful
review_detailed_main: I enjoy almost every horror film, no matter how trashy it is, and I usually never write a review. But this one, I couldn't even watch till the end. I have never seen such a bland horror film, with no moment of any horror. The plot also follows almost every other horror movie one can imagine. The worst thing is that the idea would have had the potential for a good movie. Sadly the creators forgot actually to put in any plot, so we are left with this incoherent masterpiece of trash (sorry, I didn't want to insult trash). The film's best part was when I finally hit the back button on my remote and relieved myself from this horr...ible movie.

review_title: If I could give it a 0 I would.
review_detailed_main:
Terrible, terrible movie. Not even one that's so bad it's good, or even funny, it's just bad. Great premise, bad execution, bad acting, lousy make-up effects, bad editing, bad directing, bad acting [yes, I added that twice] so don't waste your time, it truly isn't worth it.

I thought it was a great idea, something along the lines of Willy's Wonderland or the Banana Splits movie, but it had such poor production value, not a drop of humour, and terrible, terrible acting that it just falls flat. The trailer is a better movie than the movie itself!

I've seen terrible movies that were so bad they were good, but this one does not qualify in that category at all.

review_title: If you want a laugh at how bad it is I'd recommend
What the hell did I just watch
review_detailed_main: Worse movie ever....that was a waste of 1 hour 32 mins of my time that I will never get back..I was so hoping it was going to get good but nope not at all...I am so glad I didn't go see this and just waited to watch it at home because I would have asked for my money back..if I could have given this movie zero stars I would...I am speechless on how bad this movies was...the acting was horrible...I am still trying to figure out what the hell I just watched...I just want to let people know please for the love of god don't waste you time watching this movie as it sucked hardcore...save yourself the 1 hour and 32 minutes.

review_title: A very fun bloody slasher movie
review_detailed_main: I absolutely love this movie. I thought it was a very fun slasher. The blood and Gore was good a nice body count and so much more. And honestly it felt like a Old school classic like Halloween Friday the 13th which I loved. Pooh and piglet look pretty good. There was definitely some good kills in the movie. So definitely give this movie a chance. It's fun badass intense interesting. It had me at edge of my seat though out the movie. I mean yes it's not a masterpiece but it is a low budget movie that I thought it worked for what it is. So grab some friends and go have a good time. Trust me.....

review_title: What did you expect for a low budget B movie?

review_detailed_main: Ridiculous premise aside, this movie is definitely just a vehicle for the writer and/or director's thinly veiled (very thinly) hatred towards women. The treatment of the women characters in this movie is just very obviously steeped in misogyny. Was hoping for a fun, dumb horror, but got a very uncomfortable view into what is clearly someone's barely disguised fetish. Absolutely no thanks. Not to mention the absolutely abysmal costume design, confusing set design, and plot that was barely there and yet still seemed to confuse the writer themselves, based on how nonsensical it was. 0 stars, would not recommend, don't waste your time with this trash.

All I get from this is GCSE drama. I was interested because of the Winnie The Pooh title but they've made an absolute mess of this film. Terrible acting from everyone and no story to it. Most gory scenes look so unrealistic.

I would have gave a 0 star if I could have, I wouldn't bother wasting your time. Winnie and Piglet themselves look terrible I couldn't help but laugh. Piglet looks more like a war hog, it's just hilarious.

Coming from the UK myself I'm extremely embarrassed of the making of this film lmao! I love my horror movies and this definitely does not do it.

Glad I didn't pay at the cinema to watch this s#it.

review_title: One of the worst movies of all time
Winnie-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey review - makes you wish the public domain didn't exist
review_detailed_main:
Scary-movie searchers will be disappointed. Decent-movie searchers will be disappointed. And even ironic-cult-movie searchers will be, surprisingly, disappointed. What they will get instead is grossly misogynistic, horrifically unhorrific, humorlessly dull, fanfic-grade trash that should make the Supreme Court reconsider their public-domain laws.

In "Winnie-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey," a group of six women travel to the 100-Acre Wood for a cleansing getaway. However, these hapless females are soon confronted by murderous versions of Pooh and Piglet, who already have a collegiate Christopher Robin in their grasp. But rather than a taut chase thriller, it instead descends into an undercooked, off-the-rails adventure featuring two "killers" that are far more convincing as drugstore Halloween mascots than renditions of beloved childhood characters.

But the worst thing, by far, is the rampant sexism. The women are not given any common sense or individualism before their breasts are shoved into frame, their tops are torn off, and their heads are mashed by car tires and woodchippers. Rather than being strong, smart, or even capable, these women are reduced to magazine centerfolds cut and pasted with the rationality of third graders: they're constantly lost, perpetually confused, and unable to make logical decisions. The concept of fully functioning female adults was, apparently, lost in translation, unfortunately replaced with as much cleavage as possible.

Even if viewers trudge through this marsh of awful on-camera and off-camera decisions, they'd still find only embarrassing effects, the flimsiest of clichés, nonsensical plotting, cinematography and scoring that take the movie's ridiculous premise way too seriously, and strangely lifeless acting. Instead of being bloodcurdling, this film sputters, entirely exsanguinated. Few creative flops are worse than this sexist, lazy, unironic dumpster fire of a film.

...I'm SO glad I watched this free on Peacock. I actually went into it knowing, based on reviews, that it would be bad. Look, I'm all about cheap horror flicks, but this was just cheap, period.

Bad costumes, bad cinematography, bad acting, bad script, bad CGI, bad plot, bad ending...the list goes on.

If you want to watch out of sheer curiosity, (like I did), you have my condolences, Just as some reviewers have stated they don't know why it only has a 2.9 rating, I don't know why it isn't less.

You'll find plenty of more specific reviews on here, but all I have to say is; I may not have wasted my money, but I sure as heck wasted my time!

I never thought that a horror movie could be any worse than "The Strangers" buuuut this slasher Pooh movie makes the "The Strangers" an academy award finalist. Have not seen this Pooh movie, only the trailers but I think that was more than enough to justify being worse than "The Strangers". At least "The strangers" had some recognizable actors of the cast of 7. You hear of movies that turn out to be decent/good that can't get any "backing" for years until they are made/released.

Whoever fronted the $100.000 to get this movie off the ground/produced I will gladly send my personals to them so that when they can send me the money & I guarantee to make something better by just using my phone.

All these people did was take advantage (first) of the expired copyright of the AA Milne character. They bought some store halloween masks. They had decent equipment. They had "actors". They had a dream... and a nightmare for us. Not a good kind of nightmare that comes from watching a good horror film. The bad kind of nightmare from watching a totally incompetent filmmaker that had no good ideas of his own, other than taking advantage of being the first to exploit this now free to use character. Sadly, it made money and we're getting two more. This is the lowest of the low: the worst kind of filmmaking; not wanting or even caring about making something good... just wanting cash in and to make a quick buck. I have zero respect for people like that. They have no respect for you, the viewer and certainly no respect for the IP which they might as well have stolen. Please avoid this "movie" and anything that this guy does in the future or you will just get more of this tripe.

review_title: Horror take is to the slasher genre what we all hoped it would be!
review_detailed_main:
If you are walking into a theatre to watch your beloved childhood Disney characters massacre a series of innocent victims, then you most likely have a certain level of expectations that you are going to see something that lives in a world that exists among satire, horror, and general bad taste. If you walked into this film expecting the next Scream or Halloween series then you have clearly not gotten the whole point of its creation.

Throughout the film, the over-the-top gore (although mostly limited to a few brief moments) and careful attention to incite every possible slasher-film cliche proliferates the bulk of the film. You're left with two options: you can either dismiss the film due to this and claim you wished for a serious horror movie, or you can rock out to it and revel in the satirical horror film that is Winnie the Pooh: Blood and Honey.

During the screening I attended, the audience clearly chose the latter. What began as stifled smirks and chuckles quickly turned to laughing out loud at the entire ludicrous nature of the film by the final scenes. The conceptual framework of "so bad it's good" makes this film worthy of a watch in and of itself; however, there are some additional aspects that make it worthy of a closer look.

This film knows it doesn't have the budget to compete with a serious horror film, nor does it pretend to be one. The over-the-top gore and cliches are reminiscent of scenes in which a character's body is mutilated beyond recognition and the characters foolishly wonder if they should call an ambulance to help. Nearly every scene is constructed in which the obvious solution is not only ignored but the characters double down on the wrong things to do. Not since Scream has there been such a blatant satirical approach to the filmmaking process of horror films. Perhaps I'm reading much too much into this, but I feel the creators set out to create something unlike anything we had ever seen before. They were partially successful if you accept that the film is a unique take on a classic children's story. They were entirely successful if they chose to use this conceit as a vehicle from which to make a satirical statement about horror and the ways in which society embraces the genre through its own sense of nostalgia and predictability. Which perception is real is entirely up to you. Either way, you have a brilliant satire at best and a decent ride at worst.

Ok yes it's low budget it's got amature actors and the script could of been better. But come on. It's Winnie the piglet for Christ sake. You taking it serious? Some of the kills are fun it's all made on a low £100k budget. What were people expecting. I enjoyed it up to a point. I went in knowing it was going to be pretty bad but its a laugh if you let it be. Don't over think it don't over criticise it and just watch it for a bad slasher, have some fun with it and giggle at it. You never know you might enjoy it more instead of thinking you are getting a classic slasher throw back to the 80s, it was ok I have seen worse.

I was convinced by a friend to watch this movie. Despite my extremely low expectation, this film managed to disappoint not only myself, but the friends I watched it with. We had to pause numerous times simply due to how bad the acting and writing were. We all went in with the intention of hate-watching the film, but were too disappointed to even enjoy how poorly made it was. Some films are so bad that they can be enjoyed ironically, but this film isn't that. We debated over whether we should even finish the film several times during its runtime due to how often we were pausing, and ultimately felt that we had made a mistake in choosing to watch it together.

This movie is a Friday the 13th rip off taking advantage of an IP. It is uninspired garbage with no originality or care for the final product.

Pooh is naturally the main antagonist of this film and he is a copy of classic Jason Voorhees, the way he moves and acts. It's uninspired design ruins the film from the start. Pooh is very clearly a man in a mask- to the point where I once considered it a possible plot twist. Pooh has no fur and why is pooh wearing jeans? Oh yeah cause the director just doesn't care. Piglett has a worse design . Just a man in a cheap mask. They couldn't afford a mask that could talk so the characters were written as silent. They couldn't afford to show all the characters so they were mentioned in story book format.

All kills are done in quick cut format, so they can show you some gory make up of the after effect but nothing in camera. Some kills are so cheesy and poorly done it boarder-lines a parody. Several scenes feature cuts where characters are in an entirely different position before and after, because again the director just doesn't care. Plenty of movies are made cheaply with little special effects including greats like Saw, Texas Chainsaw and Night of the Living Dead but also movies like Hobo With a Shotgun, Sleepaway Camp which are not my favorites but were made with love that you can respect them for what they are.

This was made for money only. Passionless and lazy. One of the worst films I have ever seen. I think I am most angry because a talented and passionate creator could have made a really good film with this idea.

The director of this garbage is a fvcking opportunist, seeing that Winnie the Pooh became public domain to make easy money with one of the worst movies not only horror but overall of all time. There's no such thing as being so bad it's good, it's bad, period. The girl group is completely useless surpassing any group of friends of a traditional eighties slasher and the protagonist is even worse. The least that could be expected in a bad film is that it be at least funny, but this is not the case as it is a very boring film, the deaths, although grotesque, are very weak and the ending only reaffirms the poor quality of this film. Let them learn from the director of Terrifier, who, with the same budget constraints, does high-quality work and is seen to do things with love and care. Finally, fvck everyone who was involved in the making of this crap, they are embarrassing.

review_title: Maybe losing the copyright wasn't such a good thing!
review_detailed_main:
On January 1, 2022, the copyright on the original Winnie the Pooh expired. Now this did NOT include the 1960s and 70s Disney versions of the characters...but the original Milne story and the original Shepard drawings. So, as soon as they entered the public domain, the opportunistic makers of "Winnie-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey" sprang into action...rushing this bloody slasher film with many of the Pooh characters in it into production. It was apparently quickly slapped together and offended many folks. After all, Pooh and his friends were NICE....but here they have a taste for human blood! I'm assuming the concept alone would account for such a low IMDB score of 2.9...but is it BAD on top of being offensive?

The plot is VERY simple. After the characters are abandoned by Christopher Robin when he goes off to college, Pooh and Piglet make a pack to destroy people. So, they kill lots of folks...but, like too many slasher films, they mostly kill pretty young women. There's not a lot more to the story than this...just various folks going about their lives until the pig and bear turn them to hamburger.

The first technical thing I noticed is a very nicely filmed section near the beginning of the movie. I think it was just luck, as soon after I noticed the camerawork again...but NOT for a good reason. Many times, the camera jerks around and seldom stays still...though other times it seems fine. It also often frames the people wrong. I think perhaps they were trying to be artsy (as opposed to just being amateurish?)...but it just looks bad and would be worse on the big screen...inducing nausea because of the jerkiness.

The acting, for the most part, isn't especially deep. It's mostly folks running and hiding from the hellishly ugly Pooh and Piglet. I cannot say the acting is terrible...it's just the script gives the actors little more to do. There is some gratuitous nudity and the killing is particularly gruesome and nasty. Its violence level, combined with sexualized killing of women, is certainly disgusting...and it's sad this is intended as entertainment.

Overall, the film is in some ways worse than I'd imagined. Had they perhaps done it all very tongue-in-cheek it might have worked. Instead, it's just mean and nasty...and a bit hateful and exploitative towards women. Someone who really HATES women would no doubt get off on seeing some portions of the movie.

review_title: Probably the worst in this century
review_detailed_main:
This movie should be banned. Period.

The plot and acting are so terrible that are not even funny. Everything from start to beginning doesn't have sense. The writing, cast, and general atmosphere around the movie are at an all-time low.

I don't know how people working on that didn't see this massacre of a movie that they made. And don't start me talking about those costumes. Gosh, are they terribly done. I think children in kindergarten could do a better job than these guys.

The only thing at the beginning that was good was pacing, but how we are going to the end became too fast and chaotic to the point where I didn't have time to process what happened, and something new already happened.

Literally, every character was shallow and without a backstory, even the main antagonists which everyone expected some kind of a revelation at the end. But guess what? We didn't get that either.

P. S. The director should be locked up.

A childhood classic with a horror twist, what's not to love?

This movie.

It's an abomination.

The acting is awful, the script is dire and it's just an awfully cobbled together film.

I like a lot of low budget horror movies but the visuals were just shocking.

It's clearly men in ill fitting suits.

The characters are so unlikable I couldn't wait for them to be killed off and even then their deaths was farcical.

Despite me praying for the movie to finish, the ending was still disappointing.

It's the worst movie I've watched in a good while and that's really saying something.

It's not even worth putting on to fall asleep to.

Just avoid it.

Probably one of the worst movies I've ever seen in my life, I don't think I've hated a movie more than this, the acting, the script, the scenes, the costumes, everything was bad, except for some torture that was there, it's not close to being good enough for cinema, an excessive waste of time, what I can say was good is the animation at the beginning, which I thought the movie would be Pretty scary but as soon as I saw Winnie the Pooh in the movie I realized it was the least scary horror movie I'll ever see. I'm not kidding I'm saying that I laughed at so many scenes which shouldn't happen and I hope the creators of the movie don't release another one.

The dumbest concept and the most asinine plot in history. The makers of this must have been high on something to think this was a good idea to make. The author of the Winnie the Pooh books, A. A. Milne, would be rolling in his grave if he saw this travesty. This is what happens when dumb filmmakers are allowed free reign to make trash. This should have never been allowed to be put in theaters. I hope the filmmakers go bankrupt from making this. It would serve them right for making such a grotesque film about a beloved children's book character. Let them live in shame for this. If you want a good slasher movie watch the Halloween, Friday the 13th or even Child's Play movies.

A perfectly good little horror with a great basic idea, although the potential of this concept was not fully exploited.

In any case, it's a really good little evening horror. Great setting, sufficiently terrifying negative characters, super idiotic victims, enough death, guts and blood. We would have liked to have seen Owl and Tigris, unfortunately they did not join the massacre.

It's no worse than other well-known and classic franchises, of course professionalism requires more than that.

It's nice to see that the makers put everything into this masterpiece regardless of this, it shows that there was work involved.

review_title: Bad, but not in a fun way
review_detailed_main: I was so disappointed. I went in expecting to be in uproarious laughter at how campy and silly this movie was. Unfortunately, it wasn't funny bad, it was just bad bad. Imagine every single bad horror movie trope and sprinkle a tiny bit of hunny on top and you've got this movie. The opening 10 minutes were somewhat promising, but the remainder of the movie just wasn't fun, scary, or even that impressive in any way. Really felt let down with this one. There were some scenes that made made me laugh at how stupid and bad they were, but the laughs were not very common and it just felt frustrating watching the characters all behave like morons, while watching a Jason ripoff in a Winnie the Pooh mask parade around pulling people's heads off in the most boring manner possible.

Just looking to make horror movies. Bad movie. Not recommended. Abuse of girls. The story is stupid. They tried to do something with Winnie the Pooh but Without success. Because it's so much bad, I don't understand how it was broadcast I think they paid more for the film than they bought it As if the creators of the films are not tired of doing such things Ugh!

Pilot Many years ago, a young Christopher Robin met a group of anthropomorphic creatures - Winnie-the-Pooh, Piglet, Eeyore, Rabbit, and Owl - in the Hundred Acre Wood, and they became friends with him. However, as he grew older, Christopher entered college and left them behind. Without Christopher to feed them or give them guidance, and with the arrival of winter, Pooh, Piglet, Rabbit, and Owl went into extreme starvation and killed and ate Eeyore, which traumatised the group to the point where they developed a hatred for anything human-related, as well as Christopher for abandoning them. The group then made a pact to abandon their humanity and return to their feral instincts, also vowing never to speak again 0 stars out of 10.

After watching Megan in which I had low expectations and was disappointed,I was so hyped for this one. Turns out this is just another typical slasher movie. Story does not go anywhere,characters making dumb decisions,no build up or tension, and above all there is no real motive on why pooh and piglet are killing. The kills are decent with cgi blood and the worst part was just mindless and no creativity. I would say the only positives I can take away are the music score and just a few kills. I am a big horror fan but this movie offers nothing new. I really hope horror does get better this year because this one was not good.

Winnie the Pooh is a beloved childhood icon! To turn something so innocent and loving into a bloodthirsty monster is just despicable! The characters would never become killers!

The reason doesn't even make sense! They turn feral because they're hungry? They're stuffed animals! And the Hundred Acre Wood has plenty of food. Christopher Robin would never leave them so that they would be so dependent on him that they'd be unable to survive. It's nonsensical!

And from their behaviors, they didn't act like feral animals. Feral animals don't carry huge axes or chop away sadistically. And neither do these characters.

If you value your childhood, DO NOT watch this!

When I went to see this movie at the cinema I found the story very ridiculous, the ridiculous characters and a very weak script.

You would say, ok the movie isn't that bad, for a very low budget movie, but maybe you're right or maybe you're not, but I respect what you think. Ok, changing the subject, here goes my review. To begin with, do not take the children to see this movie because it is very bloody and there is a lot of blood and honey.
